dalserver

Class ConfigTable

  • java.lang.Object
    • dalserver.ConfigTable
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Iterable

    public class ConfigTable
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Iterable
    The ConfigTable class implements a dynamic table configuration mechanism used to customize the contents of the table output produced by service queries. The ConfigTable class provides a means to customize the output of a service request on a per-service-instance basis. By default services output a standard set of most-commonly used metadata. Fields that are not assigned values are output anyway with a null value, which is harmless. Table configuration allows unused fields to be omitted, additional standard or custom metadata to be added, or field attributes to be customized. The default field attributes for standard fields are defined by the data model type and version used by the runtime protocol. Values may be specified at the ConfigField level to override the standard data model field attributes, or to supply attribute values for a custom field. Table config metadata is provided as part of the custom configuration for a service, in a ".tab" file (optional). Configuration is on a per-service basis. Table configuration information is passed into the service at runtime servlet context initialization parameters, included in the input parameter set for the servlet.

    • Constructor Detail

      • ConfigTable

        public ConfigTable(ParamSet params,
           KeywordFactory kwfactory)
            throws DalServerException
        Create a ConfigTable instance from the table config-related parameters in the servlet input parameter set.
        Parameters:
        params - A parameter set containing table-config params
        kwfactory - Data model keyword factory to be used The input parameter set is normally the main input parameter set for the calling servlet, but in principle it could be any parameter set containing table config parameters. The table config parameters are passed as a subgroup named "table.{standard|custom}." within the input parameter set.
        Throws:
        DalServerException

        public void setMask(java.lang.String mask)
        Set the mask value.
        Parameters:
        mask - Keyword mask.

      • getField

        public ConfigField getField(java.lang.String name)
        Get the named ConfigField from the ConfigTable instance.
        Parameters:
        name - The name of the field Null is returned if the field is not found.

      • getColname

        public java.lang.String getColname(java.lang.String name)
        Get the table column name for the named ConfigField.
        Parameters:
        name - The name of the field If no custom table column name has been assigned then the ConfigField name is returned. If the field is not found then null is returned.

      • addGroup

        public void addGroup(RequestResponse response,
            TableGroup group)
        Conditionally add a new Group to a Response object.
        Parameters:
        response - A RequestResponse instance
        group - A TableGroup instance In the current implementation addGroup requests are always passed on to the RequestResponse class since we have no easy way to check for an empty Group; if needed this check can be made higher up.

      • addField

        public void addField(RequestResponse response,
            TableField field)
        Conditionally add a new Field to a Response object.
        Parameters:
        response - A RequestResponse instance
        field - A TableField instance The Field instance is added unless it is flagged to be omitted in the ConfigTable. Any custom attributes are propagated to the Field instance.

      • addParam

        public void addParam(RequestResponse response,
            TableParam param)
        Conditionally add a new Param to a Response object.
        Parameters:
        response - A RequestResponse instance
        param - A TableParam instance The Param instance is added unless it is flagged to be omitted in the ConfigTable. Note at the level of ConfigTable we do not distinguish between FIELDs and PARAMs. Any custom attributes are propagated to the created Param instance.

      • addStandardFields

        public int addStandardFields(RequestResponse response)
                      throws DalServerException
        Add any remaining standard fields not explicitly added to the output Response object.
        Parameters:
        response - A RequestResponse instance For each standard Field in the ConfigTable, check to see if it has already been added to the output Response object, and if not, create an instance of the keyword from the given data model keyword factory, and add it to the Response object. Note that ConfigTable only deals with table Fields (not constant-valued Params) since it is used to map data from a DBMS table into the output Response table. The DM keyword factory keeps track of which keywords are in which data model group, and the Response object sorts out the groups when the table is eventually output, so we can add keyword instances (fields) in any order. The keywords added here are likely to be added long after the first block of keywords were added to the group to which the keyword belongs.
        Throws:
        DalServerException

      • addCustomFields

        public int addCustomFields(RequestResponse response)
                    throws DalServerException
        Add any custom fields, not already explicitly added, to the output Response object.
        Parameters:
        response - A RequestResponse instance For each custom Field in the ConfigTable, check to see if it has already been added to the output Response object, and if not, create a generic TableField for the ConfigField and add it to the Response object.
        Throws:
        DalServerException

      • iterator

        public java.util.Iterator iterator()
        Get an iterator to access the ConfigTable as a list.
